children.text:
Now, putting all together in code. The code structure:

program main

  implicit none

  integer :: n, count, N, ans, count_digits, temp, i, j

  integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: h, g

  read(*,*) n

  allocate(h(n), g(n))

  do i =1, n

     read(*,*) h(i), g(i)

  end do

  count =0

  do i=1, n

     do j=1, n

        if (h(i) == g(j)) then

           count = count +1

        end if

     end do

  end do

  N = count

  temp = N

  count_digits =0

  do while (temp >0)

     count_digits = count_digits +1

     temp = temp /10

  end do

  ans =0

  do i=1, count_digits

     if (i == count_digits) then

        if (mod(i,2) ==1) then

           ans = ans + (N - 10**(i-1) +1)

        end if

     else

        if (i ==1) then

           ans = ans +9

        else if (mod(i,2) ==1) then

           ans = ans + (10**i - 10**(i-1))

        end if

     end if

  end do

  write(*,*) ans

end program main

First, the first Java program (codeforces_268_A) reads an integer n, then reads n pairs of integers h[i] and g[i]. It then counts how many times a h value equals a g value. The result is printed.

The second Java program (atcoder_ABC136_B) takes an integer N, counts the number of digits, and calculates some sum based on the digits. The output is the sum ans.

The key is to chain them: the output of the first becomes the input of the second. But in Fortran, I need to do this without I/O in between. So the first program's output (the result) is the input to the second. So the Fortran program must first process the first part, then use that result as N for the second part, then output the final answer.

1. Read n, then read n pairs of h and g arrays.
2. Compute the count of h[i] == g[j] for all i,j.
3. Use that count as N in the second part's algorithm.
4. Compute the ans for the second part using N.
5. Output the ans.

The code structure:

program main

  implicit none

  integer :: n, count, N, ans, count_digits, temp, i, j

  integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: h, g

  read(*,*) n

  allocate(h(n), g(n))

  do i =1, n

     read(*,*) h(i), g(i)

  end do

  count =0

  do i=1, n

     do j=1, n

        if (h(i) == g(j)) then

           count = count +1

        end if

     end do

  end do

  N = count

  temp = N

  count_digits =0

  do while (temp >0)

     count_digits = count_digits +1

     temp = temp /10

  end do

  ans =0

  do i=1, count_digits

     if (i == count_digits) then

        if (mod(i,2) ==1) then

           ans = ans + (N - 10**(i-1) +1)

        end if

     else

        if (i ==1) then

           ans = ans +9

        else if (mod(i,2) ==1) then

           ans = ans + (10**i - 10**(i-1))

        end if

     end if

  end do

  write(*,*) ans

end program main
